articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. and Ukraine have agreed on the terms of a draft minerals deal central to Kyiv's push to win Washington's support as President Donald Trump seeks to rapidly end the war with Russia, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.
articles.title: US, Ukraine agree to terms of critical minerals deal

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Dozens of countries rallied behind Ukraine at a meeting at the United Nations in Geneva on Tuesday, a day after the U.N. Security Council adopted a U.S.-drafted resolution that takes a neutral stance on the conflict.
articles.title: Countries tell Ukraine 'you are not alone' after UN adopts neutral stance on war

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: Finance ministers and central bankers from the G20 top economies gather in South Africa on Wednesday and Thursday, for a meeting marred by the absence or curtailed attendance of key members and disputes over the main issues of climate, debt and inequality.
articles.title: G20 finance ministers, central bankers to meet amid fractious geopolitics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and Iran's top leaders aligned positions on issues around Iran's nuclear programme at talks in Tehran on Tuesday, Russia's Foreign Ministry said.
articles.title: Russia's Lavrov aligns positions with Iran on nuclear programme

articles.author: Fabian Cambero, Alexander Villegas
articles.description: A massive power outage across Chile plunged the country's capital Santiago into darkness on Tuesday and knocked out electricity to major copper mines in the country's north, buffeting global metal markets.
articles.title: Chile power outage plunges capital into darkness, hits major copper mines

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's government said on Wednesday that Taiwan was "manipulating" possible Chinese involvement in the latest severing of an undersea communications cable, saying the island was casting aspersions before the facts were clear.
articles.title: China says Taiwan 'manipulating' undersea cable cutting before facts clear

articles.author: Christine Chen
articles.description: Cook Islands Prime Minister Mark Brown survived on Wednesday a vote of no confidence in parliament brought by the opposition over deals he struck with China that strained relations with New Zealand.
articles.title: Cook Islands PM survives no-confidence vote over China pact

articles.author: Steven Aristil, Mickenson Duverger
articles.description: Armed gangs launched a fresh attack on Haiti's capital before dawn on Tuesday, killing residents in the Delmas 30 neighborhood and causing more residents to flee as gangs continue to operate unchecked in the Caribbean nation.
articles.title: Haiti gangs launch deadly attack on capital's Delmas neighborhood

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis, battling double pneumonia, remains in critical condition for the fourth day running but is stable and has not had any further respiratory crises, the Vatican said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Pope Francis in critical condition for fourth day running, but stable, Vatican says

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Andrew Mills
articles.description: Israel is considering an extension of the 42-day truce in Gaza as it seeks to bring home the remaining 63 hostages, while putting off agreement on the future of the enclave for now, Israeli officials said.
articles.title: Israel looks to extend phase one of Gaza truce as long-term deal proves elusive
